org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet

Class ProtocolTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.derbynet.ProtocolTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class ProtocolTest
extends BaseTestCase
    This class is used to test error conditions in the protocol.

    The protocol to send to the Net server is contained in a file encoded as calls to routines in DDMReader and DDMWriter. Additional commands have been added for testing purposes. To add tests, modify the file protocol.tests. Tests can also be done as separate files and given as an argument to this class.

    This test was copied / converted from testProto.

      • commandSequence

        private java.lang.String commandSequence
        The sequence of commands this test is composed of.

        The sequence is expected to be line oriented, that is a one command and optionally its arguments per line. The lines must be separated by a newline token.

      • adapter

        private org.apache.derby.impl.drda.ProtocolTestAdapter adapter
        The adapter that lives on the DRDA package, allowing us to call the otherwise unavailable methods we need to call in package private classes.

        Parameters:

        startLine - starting line in the source file
        lines - number of lines from the source file

      • readSecMecAndSECCHKCD

        private void readSecMecAndSECCHKCD()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Handle the case of testing the reading of SECMEC and SECCHKCD, where on an invalid SECMEC value for ACCSEC, the server can send valid supported SECMEC values. One of the valid supported value can be EUSRIDPWD (secmec value of 9) depending on if the server JVM can actually support it or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - error reading file or protocol

      • assertCP

        private void assertCP(int reqCP,
                      int cp)
        Codepoint error
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - error reading command file

      • ln

        private int ln(java.io.StreamTokenizer st)
        Calculates the current line number from the source file.

        The intention is to be able to print which line number the test failed on, so that the source of the error can be easily located.

        Parameters:
        st - processing stream tokenizer
        Returns:
        The calculated current line number.
